contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=January 2013}} '''The Triumph of Time''' is a poem by [[Algernon Charles Swinburne]], published in 1866. It is in adapted [[ottava rima]] and is full of elaborate use of literary devices, particularly [[alliteration]]. The theme, which purports to be autobiographical, is that of rejected love. The (male) speaker deplores the ruin of his life, and in tones at times reminiscent of ''[[Hamlet]]'', craves oblivion, for which the sea serves as a constant metaphor. '''''The Triumph of Time''''' is also the US title of [[James Blish]]'s novel ''A Clash of Cymbals''. ==External links== {{wikisource}} *[http://rpo.library.utoronto.ca/poem/2104.html Complete text of the poem] *[http://www.victorianweb.org/authors/swinburne/swinburne9.html#1 ''Victorian Web'' article on the poem] {{DEFAULTSORT:Triumph Of Time}} [[Category:British poems]] [[Category:1866 poems]]
